headline: Lemon Square Bars
description: A traditional lemon bar. These can be dressed up by adding a layer of meringue too!

video.description: These traditional lemon bars have a lovely buttery crust and sweet-tart filling
video.name: Lemon Square Bars

name: Lemon Square Bars

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 9x13 inch pan.
In a medium bowl, stir together 2 cups flour and confectioners' sugar. Blend in the melted butter. Press into the bottom of the prepared pan.

Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes, or until golden. In a large bowl, beat eggs until light. Combine the sugar, baking powder and 1/4 cup of flour so there will be no flour lumps. Stir the sugar mixture into the eggs. Finally, stir in the lemon juice. Pour over the prepared crust and return to the oven.
Bake for an additional 30 minutes or until bars are set. Allow to cool completely before cutting into bars.

review.reviewBody: The lemon squares I made from this recipe took 17 more minutes to bake and could use a little bit more butter and powdered sugar in the crust. Other than that they tasted fine. My crust was a bit tough however I believe it was because of the need for a bit more butter and I may have over blended the crust.
Just pulled out my bars from the oven. I agree that 30 mins would have been way too long. 20 was perfect.

Not so impressed, the 30 minutes baking time at the end turned my lemon squares brown on top, too long of a cooking time. Change to 20 minutes perhaps. Shame that that was not suggested from the beginning
I made these last year for Xmas. Everyone loved them!
This is a very easy yet delicious recipe!

These lemon bars are delightfully sensational. Your guests will enjoy the fragrance as it bakes in the oven, the topping crackling against the knife, the cheery yellow color, the feel of smooth lemon curd against the tongue, the juxtaposition of sweet and tangy flavors. Best of all, they're easy to make! This one is a keeper!

These lemon bars were a hit at the party I brought them to! They were super simple to put together and used ingredients that I always have on hand. I did end up adding the zest from 3 lemons to the sugar mixture, and I would definitely recommend it! They were tart, lemony, and not overly sweet. My bars only baked for 25 minutes, but they ended up being a little brown on the top. Next time I would check them at about 20 minutes. I cut these into bite sized pieces and dusted them with confectioners' sugar.
Delicious. We like a bold lemon flavor so we used 3/4 cups of lemon juice and 1 tablespoon of lemon zest. Topped with icing sugar and lemon zest.
nope
I made the squares and before I put it in the oven I sprinkled one cup of coconut on top with a lemon grind it added a bit more texture and a very nice flavour it turned out really great.
Excellent! Used soft butter not melted.

I loved these . The only changes I made were to add lemon zest to the crust and filling. I also made extra filling but ended up not using it and the ratio turned out perfect for my taste. It did not stick to the pan at all, I was worried about that from other reviews. I took them to a cookout and it was a big hit. I am making them again today !
Super easy and delicious

I've tried several different recipes on allrecipes and believe this to be the superior recipe. Other recipes the shortbread and lemon are almost 1:1 and the lemon isn't lemony enough. This recipe is probably 3/4 lemon and 1/4 shortbread and truly makes the lemon shine. Also I am lactose intolerant so I used lactose free butter and the bars still came out phenomenally!
Great taste, my family loved it! For us the crust was a little too thick. I would reduce it next time.
It's easy and delicious. I've made it twice, my friends and family love them. Thank you for taking the time to share it.
I've made this recipe a few times now, and each time, my family has raved about it. It's very lemony and not too sweet!
We love this recipe for lemon bars. I use oil instead of butter in the crust. Yummy

This is a great recipe! The only things I would say is that you might need to bake the crust a little longer than 15 minutes. Also, you might need to take the lemon bars out sooner than 30 minutes. Don’t let them get too brown!
Loved it. The only change I did was add a tsp of lemon zest. It was yummy!
I love the flavor of this recipe but I can never get the filling to gel! I’ve tried leaving it in the oven longer, but that just gives me a crust that is very hard sitting on top of a liquid mess

I decided to make lemon bars today, but couldn’t find my recipe. I decided to try this one because I didn’t have any lemons, just lemon juice. I made this exactly as directed. Didn’t change a thing. Very, very good! A little different then mine, but I think this might be my new go to recipe.

LOVE this recipe. Others I followed were not a good. Much more lemon custard for a thicker layer... I added more lemon juice but not much. And the crust layer with the melted butter instead of cutting in the butter made a butterier less crumbly cookie layer. Will use this recipe from this point forward!
Amazing. Simple to make, perfect cookie/bar dough.
Crowd pleaser!
First time to make it. My son really loved it.
Turned out great! I used 2parts lemon juice 1 part lime. Other than that will definitely make again!
The Fam loved them!! Added the confectioner sugar and they were divine!
Super easy and quick to make! I will definitely be making this again!!!!!!

I make lemon square bars at least twice a month. I usually make an 8x8 size. I use the zest of one lemon and a 1/2 (yes, one half) cup of fresh squeezed lemon juice. So when making a 9x13 inch batch, that would be the zest of two lemons and 1 cup of fresh lemon juice. I (and friends/colleagues) LOVE the intense lemon flavor. The amount of sugar in the recipe keeps that amount of lemon from making you pucker. (I also prefer to cut cold butter into the flour/powdered sugar for the pastry crust...melted butter doesn't affect the taste, but I think the crust is much more tender and delicate this way.) Happy baking!
It's a hit at any function !!!
I thought it was OK, but my mom loved it, so I'm meeting in the middle. I used an 8x11.5 inch pan, which I would not recommend. It's more cake height than bar height now.

No changes at all 
My daughter and grandson loved these lemon bars 
As the were here over new years I have Made these several times for different occasions and they are enjoyed by everybody 
Great bars
Just added some lemon zest to the crust and also to the egg mixture.

I liked this recipe for its simplicity. However, I used real lemons for the juice and added grated lemon rind to the crust. Next time I will use a smaller pan because the filling was not thick enough. Will make this again. Love the lemon flavour.
These were the perfect addition to our Thanksgiving meal last year. I will be making them again this year
I used Splenda instead of sugar. Always a great bar. My family loves them.
Follow the recipe! These turned out perfectly and are delicious. I followed the recipe exactly and will be making them again
Follow the recipe! These turned out perfectly and are delicious. I followed the recipe exactly and will be making them again
I made it just as recipe instructed and it was delicious
Oh my goodness this is so easy to make and it's delicious!!!
I liked it, I did add more lemons to it, and doubled the filling recipe.

These are delicious! I used fresh squeezed lemon juice and the zest from one lemon added to the mix. Additionally, for an extra lemon kick I grated another lemon zest and added that to the base layer. Very tart and fragrant.
Love these!
Was a BIG hit! Will make them again. Yummmm
there are some differences between the written recipe and the video. looking forward to trying these
loved it one request add zest it was perfect make sure it cooled thought
Forgot to lower oven temp to 325 ( glass pan ) , Way to much crust for a 9~13 pan.
No changes will make this recipe again, so easy and delicious

LOVED these!! I reduced the 2 cups of flour for the crust to 1 3/4th cup flour. I baked the crust for 12, rather then 15 minutes (I have a gas stove so it cooks faster). Just keep an eye on it. Let the crust cool a little before you pour the lemon batter on it. I baked for 22 minutes, rather then 30 again b/c of the gas stove. Delicious!!

Promised to bring along the dessert for a party at a friends place but got really late at work. I managed to make these lemon bars in half an hour and pop them in the oven while I got ready. They were a huge hit with everyone.

So I only made the filling from the recipe as I chose to use an oatmeal crust to add more texture. I doubled the recipe for a 9x13 pan. I added the amount of lemon juice called for and added lemon zest from 1 lemon to it as well. I messed up and only used 1.5 cups of sugar in the doubled recipe (I usually like to use less sugar than called for, but I WOULD HAVE used 3 cups in this case) and I'm glad that I did because it was perfectly sweet enough for me. I can't imagine what 3 cups of sugar would have tasted like!
Made as per recipe and they are delicious. Froze a few and they were good, too.

I have never made or tried lemon squares before so I wasn't sure how they would turn out. 

This recipe was very easy to follow but I would like to add that for first time makers of this recipe, you may have to cook the crust for a little bit longer than the 15 mins. I had to cook mine for 20. Also for those not used to making lemon squares, I didn't know that it was okay for them to still be "jiggly" in the oven and would finish setting once they had cooled completely.

Still came out great though! Will be making this again!

I used Paige's recommendations. Finally a less sweet lemon bar that really lets the lemon flavor shine through!!! My lemons were a little small so to get the max juice from them I microwaved them for about 30 sec and then rolled them back and forth. Juicy juicy juicy!

Perfectly delicious as is. The second time around I tried pulsing cold butter with the flour and confectioners' sugar in my food processer and then pressing it into the pan. I also added lemon zest for a little extra tang. Can't go wrong with this recipe.
Amazing Lemon Bars! Used fresh Lemons and will keep making this receipe.

I love anything with lemon in it and this is no exception! I changed the recipe just a tad. For the crust, I used softened/room temperature butter, not melted. (5/8 c is 1/2 c plus 2 tb) I used a pastry cutter to mix all the ingredients. I sprayed a tiny bit of oil onto a pan that was smaller than a bit smaller than a 9X13 pan because with a 9x13, the bars were too thin. I lined with parchment paper and sprayed again, a must! The dough was very crumbly, but so easy to put in the pan. I just used my fingers to spread. I also added an extra 1 rounded TBL of flour to the custard because last time it came out too gooey. I only used 1 3/4 c. of white sugar. I cooked the crust for 20 minutes and then cooked the entire thing for 30 minutes. After the 30 minutes were done, I shut off the oven and let it stay inside for 5 minutes. Overall, a delicious recipe.
It was so good and I will definitely make it again.
Took Paige's advice in her comment and mine turned out delicious. Really happy with this recipe will defiantly make these again.
I did not care for this recipe. They were flat and chewy.
I added lime to it because I didn't have enough lemon . turned out very yummy
Superb! Made it a dozen times and will continue making it
Very good!
Awesome! My mom and I used to make these all the time when I was young. Brings back lots of memories. Thank you.
Love this super easy and tasty

yes I did! and it taste delightful.. not too sweet but you can taste the lemon flavour.. I brought it to work and it was gone fast.. got lots of feed back from coworkers.. its really good with coffee!
Followed the recipe. Delicious!
I have made this recipe for years. It is fast, reliable and delicious!

I read a few reviews and decided to make it without any changes. It was delicious and coworkers raved. I did bake the crust longer than the recipe stated as every oven is different and I used a glass 9x13 dish. I baked until the edges were golden. The crust was a perfect shortbread. The lemon flavor was intense and perfectly balanced with the sweetest of the recommended amount of sugar. Only one piece left over that tasted even better the second day!

Oh my goodness!! These were soooo good!!! And they were so easy to put together!!! I loved that I didn’t have to cut the butter into the flour for shortbread base, mixing it up was a breeze and the texture didn’t suffer at all. I added only one thing: the zest of the lemons I squeezed for the juice and it was a nice addition. I took these bars to a dessert fellowship at church and the platter was soon empty. Will definitely make these again and they are on the list of recipes for tea parties!
sooo good buttery bottom and great lemon flavor

The 2 star rating is for the modified recipe by other bakers. 
 I found that if you are cutting the butter into the dry ingredients for the crust you need the 1 c. butter the recipe calls for. Otherwise, like my crust, there is not enough fat to keep the crust from cracking. However, if you plan on melting the butter then adding it to the dry ingredients per the recipe, the amount of butter can be cut down to 3/4 c.
 In my opinion, because the modifications (which I agree with) call for 3/4 c. fresh lemon juice plus lemon zest to boost the lemon flavor, the 2 c. granulated sugar which the recipe calls for is accurate. Reducing the sugar to 1-1/4 c. causes an imbalance of tartness to sweetness. The taste was akin to under sweetened lemonade. To save the lemon squares I made with the modified recipe amounts I made a vanilla icing to try to balance out the flavor.
 One last thing, the squares bake up pretty flat in a 9x13 pan. Either make 1-1/2 the filling or use a smaller pan.
delicious!

I was worried these would not be lemony enough or that they might have a soggy crust or be too sweet because of so many reviewers' comments. Oh my goodness, these are perfect just as the recipe reads! Took them to church and everyone loved them. Very, very good, and so easy to make! Delicious, thank you!!
Don’t listen to any of the other reviews because this recipe is perfect just the way it is

Simple, classic, fresh lemony delicious. I cut back on the butter in the crust by substituting some vegetable shortening but it wasn’t as good. Going to make again w all butter but cut back by 2 tbsp as read in another review.

these are ok .a lot different than other lemon bars I have made ..looks more like a cake when done then other bars .
 I think they need more lemon taste .

These are delicious! The times were right on. I used 2 big lemons to get the exact amount of lemon juice. I used an 8x8 glass pan and a loaf pan. One to share and one for the family. It was the perfect amount. And using spray, then parchment, then spray again was such a great tip! We wouldn’t want any of that lemony goodness left in the pan. This is my go to lemon bar recipe for sure!

Dear lord, these are REALLY good. Like, stand-in-line-for-an-hour-at-a-fancy-bakery good. Super tart, lemony filling and a chewy, slightly sweet, buttery, succulent crust. Slight changes: Used 2/3 lemon juice and whole wheat flour.

I would make these again and again.
So easy to make!! Very good to eat!
turned out wonderfully. first time ever bars came out of pan intact. no throw always in the whole bunch. bummer because those are the ones I allow my family to sample!

The crust turned out fine. Took about 8 minutes longer to bake than on the recipe. However the filling was a disaster. It did not set properly and it had what I would say was an eggy texture. Threw them out as they could not be cut or served properly.
So Yummy!! my family loves these! I've made them a lot, and always look forward to my family and friends enjoying them. I am going to make them tonight with a Meringue topping!

I used two large lemons and these bars were out of this world!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! I LOVED this recipe and will definitely recommend it to friends and family! This we be my go-to recipe for lemon squares:)

Great recipe, I use lemon zest in it to make it more lemony.
Not sure who came up with 5/8 what a difficult measure - it seems OK with 1/2 cup and a bit.
it was fun and tasty and chewy and tart
This is my "go-to" recipe for lemon bars. Consistently turns out great every time!

These are delicious!! Instead of melted butter in the crust I cut in cold butter. Also did as Naples and did 1 1/2 times the lemon filling, just because, and glad I did :) because of this though I had to add on about 12 minutes of cook time. Husband devoured two of them after dinner, and I had to stop him as he was reaching for another lol.
I followed directions and will definitely make it again .
Consistency was good and crust was tasty.
Followed the recipe as noted. Will make these again!
These are the best lemon squares I have made. Follow the recipe to a tee and you won't be disappointed.

Great lemon bars! The only thing I did differently was I used softened, not melted butter and I added about 1/4 teaspoon of salt to the crust as I saw another reviewer suggest. They were awesome. I could eat the whole pan! Flaky, buttery crust, nice lemon flavor!

It's a great basic recipe as written - and easy! Based on other reviews I increased the filling by 25% and added 5 minutes to the baking time of both the crust and the bars and it came out perfect. I just wanted them a little thicker than it looked like they would have been with the initial recipe - personal preference only.
So Yummy
Easy to make and really good! Not too sweet or tart. Will definately be making these again.
The picture looked better than it tastes. Too much egg and tasted like flour. I followed it to a tee.

I made is recipe for an event and got rave reviews. The only thing I changed was I did not melt the butter and added the lemon zest to both the crust and the filling. I am definitely going to make this recipe again
